item.title: Slides
item.description: Note The slides found at this location are meant to be used in personal reference. If you are reading these slides for the first time, or are presenting these slides we recommended using the Fullscreen option found below. Fullscreen .reveal .slides ol, .reveal .slides dl, .reveal .slides ul { display: block !important; text-align: left !important; margin: 0 !important; } .reveal .slides h1, h2 { margin-top: 0 !

item.title: Walkthrough
item.description: Content Links Review: Basic Git Workflow Forking a Repository Cloning a Repository Git Branches Creating Branches Changing Branches Staging Changes Merging Review Existing Code Git Merge Git Rebase

item.title: Exercises
item.description: Exercises New Project Bonus: Git Revert Questions & Answers What is git? CLICK FOR ANSWER Distributed version control software. What is a local git repository? CLICK FOR ANSWER A git repository that lives on your local computer. Development happens in local git repositories. What is a remote git repository? CLICK FOR ANSWER A git repository that lives on a team accessible remote server.

item.title: Next Steps
item.description: Going to the source is the best way to learn a tool. The git official website and GitHub repositories: Git Homepage Git Documentation Git GitHub Repos In addition the Atlassian resources for learning git are fantastic: Atlassian: Learn Git Atlassian: Beginner Atlassian: Getting Started Atlassian: Collaborating Atlassian: Advanced Tips
